lines.text: Someone has been in my apartment and they've done things, little things, to let me know that he's there.
You look late. Beautiful, but late
I'd be willing to bet that her apartment is pretty bare, not cluttered. You would know if a book had been moved.
And maybe for the college boys, the truest mirror is the toilet bowl staring back at them the morning after a toga party.
I am not the reflection of anything. I am not an illusion. I am the truth. I'm invisible. Unknowable. You people are the real illusionists. You people are the real illusionists!

[while teaching a self-defense class]
Situations do arise where there is no-one around to help you and you have to defend yourself by whatever means necessary. You cannot say that you'd don't believe in violence unless you also say you don't believe in living.
